item.title: Larry add a quote by Ed Lynskey
item.description: "I cadged a complimentary green matchbook with a gold bird icon from the Bell canning jar. Later we'd use the matches to light our spliffs. My fingertips tapped the stem to the gizmo that dinged a bell. Nobody came out. Wrong signal, so I did two bell rings. No response prompted me to tap out a series of bell rings." -- Ed Lynskey

item.title: Larry add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I predict future happiness for Americans, if they can prevent the government from wasting the labors of the people under the pretense of taking care of them." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Larry add a quote by James Bovard
item.description: "Democracy must be something more than two wolves and a sheep voting on what to have for dinner." -- James Bovard

item.title: Larry add a quote by Edward R. Murrow
item.description: "A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves." -- Edward R. Murrow

item.title: Larry add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people's money." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The government is merely a servantâ€•merely a temporary servant; it cannot be its prerogative to determine what is right and what is wrong, and decide who is a patriot and who isn't. Its function is to obey orders, not originate them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Larry add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The most dangerous man to any government is the man who is able to think things out for himself, without regard to the prevailing superstitions and taboos. Almost inevitably he comes to the conclusion that the government he lives under is dishonest, insane, and intolerable..." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Larry add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "No man's life, liberty, or property are safe while the legislature is in session." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain
